Some of the differences between the terms 'understanding', 'intelligence', 'comprehension', and 'knowledge' are not subtle. Intelligence stands out from the others because it is an ability. We often measure intelligence by knowledge that has been gained. Actually the level of intelligence measures the ease with which a person can learn and solve problems. A person from another place or time with high intelligence may comprehend a completely different body of knowledge than a person from here and now. Knowledge usually refers to the actual facts, theories and processes that a person learns. Understanding and comprehension are the most similar terms, with comprehension having the connotation of a greater amount of ‘understanding’ or insight than simple understanding.

Keep in mind that definitions are general things. People develop their own exact definitions due to their learning experiences. Here are my definitions: Understanding: to know how and why something works, and what it will do in given circumstances. Intelligence: the combination of understanding and the IQ to apply that learning to solve problems. Comprehension is a synonym for understanding. Knowledge is simply access to information. A database has lots of knowledge, but no clue how to do anything new with it. It only uses programming it remembers to do what it is told to do. No thinking. For example, an encyclopedia has lots of knowledge and no intelligence or understanding.

Not really that subtle. Intelligence has multiple meanings. When applied to a living being it refers to the base ability to do the other things you have listed. When applied to an object it means how much organized data it represents. Understanding means base ability to apply a given set of instructions, skills, or processes. Comprehension is all of that and applies some ability to cross-reference. Knowledge is the amount of storage of those same instructions, skills, or processes.

Yes. Understanding is the process of knowing something deeply. Intelligence is a personal quality: the ability to understand things. Comprehension refers to the ability to mentally encompass the whole of an idea or complex of ideas. Knowledge is basically an accumulation of facts or ideas in one’s mind.

Intelligence is what you need in order to gain understanding and knowledge. Knowledge is all the facts. Understanding is how all the facts work together. Comprehension is awareness of the general size and shape of the facts. It is the stage right before knowledge, and long before understanding.
